alert.note: Alert for Inland Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 7:57AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Palm Beach County through 830 AM EST... At 756 AM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Pahokee, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Glade, Pahokee, Canal Point, Fremd Village-Padgett Island and Port Mayaca. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
